hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: CLUSTER_FROM_SCRATCH
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Create cluster from scratch? If true, create a new cluster. Otherwise attempt to run ansible on existing cluster to re-provision it with a different kubernetes version

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: DESTROY_CLUSTER
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Destroy cluster at the end of the job?

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: KUBERNETES_BINARIES_URI
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description:
Link to kubernetes binaries. For example:
https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-release/release/v1.0.6/bin/linux/amd64 for 1.0.6 https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/sundry-automata/hyperkube/1524d74 for 1.1 https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/sundry-automata/hyperkube/dbb37d9 for trunk

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: KUBE_TESTS_DIR
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: where to clone test repo to under /var/lib/docker/gobuild/KUBE_TESTS_DIR

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: RUN_ANSIBLE_DURING_SETUP
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: whether to run ansible prior to running tests

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: ANSIBLE_FORKS
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: number of forks to use when running ansible-playbook

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# run
if [ "$RUN_TESTS" = true ]; then
rm -rf ${WORKSPACE}/density_out export K8SROOT=/var/lib/docker/gobuild/${KUBE_TESTS_DIR} set +e
fail_step=false pod_densities="${DENSITIES%\"}" pod_densities="${pod_densities#\"}"
for i in $pod_densities; do # KUBECONFIG=${K8SROOT}/kubeconfig ${WORKSPACE}/hack/terminate-namespace.sh density KUBECONFIG=${K8SROOT}/kubeconfig
kubeconfig=${KUBECONFIG:-"${HOME}/.kube/config"} regex=density poll_delay_secs=5
# Delete all Active namespaces that match the regex for ns in $(kubectl --kubeconfig=${kubeconfig} get namespaces | grep ${regex} | grep Active | awk '{print $1}'); do kubectl --kubeconfig=${kubeconfig} delete namespace $ns; done
# The namepace is going to sit around in Terminating state until k8s has removed all resources # therein, including pods, rcs, events, etc. while (kubectl --kubeconfig=${kubeconfig} get namespaces | grep ${regex}); do sleep ${poll_delay_secs}; date -u done #
mkdir -p ${WORKSPACE}/density_out/$i ${K8SROOT}/_output/local/bin/linux/amd64/ginkgo \ ${K8SROOT}/_output/local/bin/linux/amd64/e2e.test \ -- \ --kubeconfig=${K8SROOT}/kubeconfig \ --repo-root=${K8SROOT} \ --num-nodes=${NUMBER_OF_NODES} \ --ginkgo.v=true \ --ginkgo.focus="should allow starting $i pods per node" \ --ginkgo.skip="(^Density)" \ --provider= \ --gce-project= \ --gce-zone= \ --gke-cluster= \ --kube-master= \ --cluster-tag= \ --node-instance-group= \ --prefix=density \ --e2e-output-dir=${WORKSPACE}/density_out/$i | tee ${WORKSPACE}/density_out/kubernetes_autotest_$i.log
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then fail_step=true fi
${WORKSPACE}/hack/namespace_cleanup.sh --etcd etcd --config ~/.ssh/config_${CLUSTER_PREFIX}_aws done
set -e
if [ "$fail_step" = true ] ; then exit 1 fi
fi
